org.microbean.helm.maven

Class AbstractReleaseMojo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      • org.microbean.helm.maven.AbstractHelmMojo
        • org.microbean.helm.maven.AbstractReleaseMojo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContextEnabled, Mojo
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSingleReleaseMojo, ListReleasesMojo

    public abstract class AbstractReleaseMojo
extends AbstractHelmMojo
    An AbstractHelmMojo that provides other Helm-related mojo implementations the ability to work with a ReleaseManager.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    execute(Callable)

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws MojoExecutionException,
                    MojoFailureException
        Skips execution if instructed, or calls the execute(Callable) method with a Callable containing the results of an invocation of the createReleaseManager(Tiller) method.
        Throws:
        MojoExecutionException - if there was a problem executing this mojo
        MojoFailureException - if the mojo executed properly, but the job it was to perform failed in some way

      • getClientConfiguration

        public Config getClientConfiguration()
        Returns the Config describing how a DefaultKubernetesClient is to connect to a Kubernetes cluster.

        This method may return null.

        Overrides of this method may return null.

        Returns:
        a Config, or null
        See Also:
        setClientConfiguration(Config)

      • setClientConfiguration

        public void setClientConfiguration(Config config)
        Installs the Config describing how a DefaultKubernetesClient is to connect to a Kubernetes cluster.
        Parameters:
        config - the Config to use; may be null
        See Also:
        getClientConfiguration()

      • getSkip

        public boolean getSkip()
        Returns true if this AbstractReleaseMojo should not execute.
        Returns:
        true if this AbstractReleaseMojo should not execute; false otherwise
        See Also:
        setSkip(boolean)

      • setSkip

        public void setSkip(boolean skip)
        Controls whether this AbstractReleaseMojo should execute.
        Parameters:
        skip - if true, this AbstractReleaseMojo will not execute
        See Also:
        getSkip()

      • getTillerNamespace

        public String getTillerNamespace()
        Returns the Kubernetes namespace in which Tiller may be found.

        This method may return null.

        Returns:
        the Kubernetes namespace in which Tiller may be found, or null

      • setTillerNamespace

        public void setTillerNamespace(String tillerNamespace)
        Sets the Kubernetes namespace in which Tiller may be found.
        Parameters:
        tillerNamespace - the Kubernetes namespace in which Tiller may be found; may be null in which case kube-system will be used by the createTiller(DefaultKubernetesClient) method instead

      • getTillerPort

        public int getTillerPort()
        Returns the port on which Tiller may be found.
        Returns:
        the port on which Tiller may be found; normally 44134

      • setTillerPort

        public void setTillerPort(int tillerPort)
        Sets the port on which Tiller may be found.
        Parameters:
        tillerPort - the port on which Tiller may be found; normally 44134

      • getTillerLabels

        public Map<String,String> getTillerLabels()
        Returns the Kubernetes labels that Tiller Pods have.

        This method may return null.

        Returns:
        the Kubernetes labels that Tiller Pods have, or null

      • setTillerLabels

        public void setTillerLabels(Map<String,String> tillerLabels)
        Sets the Kubernetes labels that Tiller Pods have.

        Tiller Pods are normally labeled with app = helm and name = tiller.

        Parameters:
        tillerLabels - a Map containing the labels; may be null

      • execute

        protected abstract void execute(Callable<ReleaseManager> releaseManagerCallable)
                         throws Exception
        Performs a release-oriented task using a ReleaseManager available from the supplied Callable.
        Parameters:
        releaseManagerCallable - the Callable that will provide a ReleaseManager; must not be null
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • createClient

        protected DefaultKubernetesClient createClient()
                                        throws IOException
        Creates a DefaultKubernetesClient for communicating with Kubernetes clusters.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        The default implementation calls the getClientConfiguration() method and uses its return value, unless it is null, in which case a new DefaultKubernetesClient is created via its no-argument constructor.

        Returns:
        a new, non-null DefaultKubernetesClient
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem creating the client

      • createTiller

        protected Tiller createTiller(DefaultKubernetesClient client)
                       throws IOException
        Creates a Tiller and returns it.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        This implementation passes the supplied DefaultKubernetesClient to the appropriate Tiller constructor.

        Parameters:
        client - the DefaultKubernetesClient to use to communicate with a Kubernetes cluster; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new Tiller; never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if client is null
        IOException - if there was a problem creating a Tiller

      • createReleaseManager

        protected ReleaseManager createReleaseManager(Tiller tiller)
                                       throws IOException
        Creates a ReleaseManager and returns it.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        This implementation passes the supplied Tiller to the appropriate ReleaseManager constructor.

        Parameters:
        tiller - the Tiller to use to communicate with a Tiller server; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new ReleaseManager; never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if tiller is null
        IOException - if there was a problem creating a ReleaseManager

      • validateNamespace

        protected void validateNamespace(String namespace)
        Validates a Kubernetes namespace for correctness.

        The default implementation checks the supplied namespace to see if it is less than or equal to characters, and if it matches the value of the ReleaseManager.DNS_LABEL_PATTERN field.

        Parameters:
        namespace - the namespace to validate; may be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if namespace is invalid
